results.description: Compare short-term option directional bias: zscore of (call_breakeven_20 - put_breakeven_20) over 30 days. Applied SUGGESTION1 by combining two breakeven fields; SUGGESTION2 not applicable (no vector fields); SUGGESTION3 not required (coverage ~0.70); SUGGESTION4 applied by selecting maturities with reasonable userCount. Kept operators <=7 and datafields=2 per KEEP_IN_MIND. confidence = 0.64

Signal when forward price diverges from options-implied breakeven: zscore of (forward_price_30 - option_breakeven_30) over 20 days. Used 2 datafields per SUGGESTION1; no vector fields; coverage OK so no ts_backfill. Respected operator/datafield limits. confidence = 0.60

Mean-reversion idea: ts_zscore(pcr_oi_10, 10) to capture extreme put-call open-interest imbalance expecting reversion. SUGGESTION1 used single high-signal field with strong user/alpha counts; SUGGESTION2 not applicable; coverage>0.7 so no backfill. Simple implementation fits KEEP_IN_MIND. confidence = 0.58

Detect fresh buying/selling flow: ts_corr(pcr_vol_30, pcr_oi_30, 20) low/negative correlation indicates unusual flow -> use as signal. Applied SUGGESTION1 combining two related fields; SUGGESTION2 not used; coverage adequate. Operators/datafields within limits. confidence = 0.55

Momentum in long-dated put skew: ts_zscore(subtract(put_breakeven_270, call_breakeven_270), 60). SUGGESTION1 used both breakevens to capture skew; chose 270d for deeper structural bias (pcr_oi_270 has high userCount). No vector fields; coverage OK. Operators<=7 and fields=2. confidence = 0.62

Short-term vs mid-term forward slope: subtract(forward_price_20, forward_price_90) and ts_zscore over 30d to capture expected near-term drift relative to mid-term. SUGGESTION1: 2 forward fields used; SUGGESTION3 not needed; obeyed KEEP_IN_MIND. confidence = 0.56

Trade mean-reversion of term-structure: ts_zscore(subtract(pcr_oi_20, pcr_oi_270), 40). Used two pcr_oi maturities per SUGGESTION1 to capture relative pressure. No vector fields; coverage high. Operators/datafields within limits. confidence = 0.59

Short-term trend of call breakeven: ts_returns(call_breakeven_10, 5) as momentum proxy for immediate directional conviction. Chose call_breakeven_10 due to high userCount per SUGGESTION4; SUGGESTION2/3 not applicable. Simple one-field implementation fits KEEP_IN_MIND. confidence = 0.52

Detect sudden increases in put-call OI: ts_delta(pcr_oi_270, 3) to catch rapid accumulation of open interest. SUGGESTION1 used single high-coverage field; SUGGESTION3 unnecessary. Operators minimal. confidence = 0.61

Dispersion in breakeven via ts_std_dev(option_breakeven_60, 30) to identify spikes in implied uncertainty that revert. Used option_breakeven_60 (single field) because coverage >0.7; SUGGESTION4 considered. KEEP_IN_MIND respected. confidence = 0.57

Relative call strength: divide(call_breakeven_20, forward_price_20) then ts_zscore over 15 days to normalize by forward. Used two fields per SUGGESTION1; vector ops not used; coverage OK. Operators <=7. confidence = 0.60

Use ts_zscore(pcr_oi_180, 90) to remove time-seasonal effects and highlight persistent imbalances. Applied SUGGESTION4 choosing pcr_oi_180 with high userCount; SUGGESTIONS2/3 not applied. Simple per KEEP_IN_MIND. confidence = 0.63
Capture medium-term drift via ts_returns(forward_price_120, 60). SUGGESTION1 limited to single forward field; SUGGESTION3 not needed due to coverage. Implementation concise. confidence = 0.54

results.idea: Put Volume Surge vs OI Build (30d corr)
results.description: ts_corr(pcr_vol_30, pcr_oi_30, 10) low correlation suggests fresh short-term buying/selling flow separate from OI; used two fields per SUGGESTION1. Coverage ok. Simple operators. confidence = 0.56

ts_returns(subtract(call_breakeven_90, put_breakeven_90), 21) to capture persistent shifts in implied direction. Used both breakevens per SUGGESTION1; SUGGESTION3 not needed. Operators/datafields within limits. confidence = 0.58

Identify when forward price is cheap/expensive relative to option-implied breakeven: divide(forward_price_360, option_breakeven_360) zscore 30d. SUGGESTION1 used both fields; no vectors. coverage OK. confidence = 0.53

results.idea: PCR OI Rapid Volatility (count of nans proxy)
results.description: Use ts_std_dev(pcr_oi_60, 20) to find unstable markets where pcr oscillates; SUGGESTION4 used pcr_oi_60 with decent userCount. SUGGESTION3 not applied. Simple implementation. confidence = 0.50

ts_zscore(subtract(call_breakeven_10, put_breakeven_10), 8) to catch very short-term skew spikes that often revert. Combined two breakeven fields per SUGGESTION1. No vector handling necessary. confidence = 0.66

Relative short-term vs long-term forward momentum: divide(ts_returns(forward_price_20,10), ts_returns(forward_price_720,60)). SUGGESTION1 used two forwards; SUGGESTION3 not needed. Kept operators within limit. confidence = 0.48

ts_zscore(subtract(pcr_oi_90, pcr_oi_270), 45) to capture cross-term deviations. Applied SUGGESTION1 with two pcr maturities and selected maturities with high historical alphaCount per SUGGESTION4. No vector ops. confidence = 0.60
ts_returns(put_breakeven_60, 15) vs its ts_zscore(.,30): here we generate momentum signal using raw returns; used single field; SUGGESTION3 not required. Implementation concise. confidence = 0.49

results.idea: Call OI Build vs Call Breakeven Move (30d)
results.description: ts_corr(pcr_oi_30, call_breakeven_30, 20) to detect when call OI changes are not translating to higher call breakevens (divergence). Used two fields, following SUGGESTION1; coverage adequate. Operators simple. confidence = 0.57
ts_zscore(option_breakeven_20, 25) to capture extreme implied price levels that tend to revert. Single field use due to KEEP_IN_MIND; SUGGESTION4 considered. confidence = 0.51
Compute subtract(pcr_vol_60, pcr_oi_60) and ts_zscore over 15 days: when vol relative to OI spikes it signals new flow. Used two fields per SUGGESTION1. No vector ops; coverage OK. confidence = 0.55

ts_rank(subtract(forward_price_20, option_breakeven_20), 20) to capture cross-sectional leader/lagger in forward vs implied. Used two fields per SUGGESTION1 and cross-sectional rank operator. No vector fields. confidence = 0.58

ts_zscore(pcr_oi_720, 90) to capture structural positioning extremes in long-dated options. Chosen pcr_oi_720 because of stable coverage; SUGGESTION2 not needed. Simple one-field approach respects KEEP_IN_MIND. confidence = 0.60

results.idea: Call Volume Surge vs Call Breakeven (10d)
results.description: ts_corr(pcr_vol_10, call_breakeven_10, 7) negative/low indicates high call volume not moving breakeven -> potential accumulation. Used 2 fields per SUGGESTION1. Coverage high. Operators minimal. confidence = 0.54
zscore(divide(put_breakeven_30, forward_price_30), 20) to find large implied downside relative to forward. Two fields used per SUGGESTION1; coverage OK. Implementation concise. confidence = 0.59

results.idea: PCR OI Momentum Acceleration (delta of returns)
results.description: subtract(ts_returns(pcr_oi_90, 5), ts_returns(pcr_oi_90, 20)) to capture acceleration in pcr trends. Single field per SUGGESTION1. No vector needed. Operators within limit. confidence = 0.52
ts_zscore(subtract(option_breakeven_90, forward_price_90), 40) to detect options re-pricing that historically predict forward drift. Used 2 datafields and avoided vector/backfill. confidence = 0.57

if_else(greater(ts_zscore(pcr_oi_20,5),2), reverse(ts_zscore(pcr_oi_20,5)), ts_zscore(pcr_oi_20,5)) — simple contrarian: reverse extreme >2 zscore. Applied SUGGESTION1 single high-count field; no vector use. Operators count small. confidence = 0.45
ts_zscore(ts_delta(option_breakeven_10,1), 10) to detect sudden jumps in implied that often mean-revert. Used ts_delta and ts_zscore on single field; coverage sufficient. confidence = 0.62

ts_zscore(divide(forward_price_30, forward_price_360), 25) to find relative cheap/expensive maturities in forward curve. Two fields used per SUGGESTION1; SUGGESTION3 not applied. Operators simple. confidence = 0.50
ts_delta(put_breakeven_20, 3) to capture rapid downside implied repricing. Single field high-coverage used per SUGGESTION4; no vector ops. Simple implementation. confidence = 0.59

divide(pcr_oi_270, pcr_oi_all) then ts_zscore over 30d to capture when long-dated OI concentrates vs aggregate. Two fields used (pcr_oi_270 and pcr_oi_all) per SUGGESTION1. Coverage OK. confidence = 0.61

results.idea: Call Breakeven Momentum Relative to Option Volume
results.description: divide(ts_returns(call_breakeven_30,10), pcr_vol_30) then ts_zscore(.,20) to normalize breakeven moves by trade volume. Two fields used as SUGGESTION1 requested multiple fields. Coverage fine. Operators within limit. confidence = 0.47

results.idea: Forward Price Reversal after PCR Spike (20d)
results.description: if_else(greater(ts_zscore(pcr_oi_20,10),1.5), reverse(ts_zscore(forward_price_20,10)), ts_zscore(forward_price_20,10)). Uses pcr as trigger and forward zscore as trade signal. Applied SUGGESTION1 combining two fields; kept to <=7 operators. confidence = 0.46

ts_ir(option_breakeven_1080, 180) to capture information ratio (mean/std) of very long-dated breakeven changes. SUGGESTION1 used single long-dated field; SUGGESTION3 unnecessary. Operators within limits. confidence = 0.44

results.idea: PCR OI vs Volatility (proxy with stddev)
results.description: ts_corr(pcr_oi_60, ts_std_dev(option_breakeven_60,30), 20) to detect whether positioning correlates with implied uncertainty increases. Uses two data-derived inputs (one is ts_std_dev result). SUGGESTION1 applied; SUGGESTION3 not required. confidence = 0.53

results.idea: Short-Term Implied Upside Momentum (call breakeven returns)
results.description: ts_returns(call_breakeven_60, 10) captures sustained implied upside moves. Single-field approach chosen per KEEP_IN_MIND. SUGGESTION4 considered. confidence = 0.50

results.idea: PCR OI Cluster Breakout (count of sudden change)
results.description: greater(ts_zscore(pcr_oi_270,7), 2) boolean signals extreme accumulation in long-dated OI indicating breakout potential. Used single high-count field as per SUGGESTION4. No vector fields. confidence = 0.58
ts_std_dev(forward_price_20, 15) to identify low-volatility regimes where trend-following tends to work. Single field used; coverage acceptable. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. confidence = 0.49

results.idea: Breakeven Skew vs PCR OI Divergence
results.description: ts_corr(subtract(call_breakeven_30, put_breakeven_30), pcr_oi_30, 20) to find when skew and OI diverge — a signal for re-pricing. Two fields used per SUGGESTION1. No vector fields. confidence = 0.60

if_else(greater(ts_zscore(put_breakeven_10,5),1.8), reverse(ts_zscore(put_breakeven_10,5)), ts_zscore(put_breakeven_10,5)). Contrarian on extreme short-term moves. Applied SUGGESTION1 single field with high userCount. confidence = 0.65

results.idea: Forward Price Momentum with PCR Filter
results.description: if_else(less(ts_zscore(pcr_oi_20,10),1), ts_zscore(forward_price_20,10), 0). Trade forward momentum only when PCR is neutral (<1 zscore). Uses two fields per SUGGESTION1; respects operator/data limits. confidence = 0.47

subtract(option_breakeven_20, option_breakeven_120) then ts_zscore over 30d to capture roll-down effects in implied prices. Two fields used per SUGGESTION1; coverage OK. Simple implementation. confidence = 0.55

results.idea: PCR OI Normalized (zscore relative to all)
results.description: ts_zscore(divide(pcr_oi_90, pcr_oi_all), 60) to normalize a maturity against aggregate, detecting concentration. Two fields used per SUGGESTION1 and SUGGESTION4. coverage acceptable. confidence = 0.62

results.idea: Forward vs Long-Dated Call Breakeven Divergence
results.description: ts_zscore(subtract(forward_price_720, call_breakeven_720), 50) to find structural differences between synthetic forward and call-level expectations. Two datafields used per SUGGESTION1. coverage ~0.70 so no backfill. confidence = 0.51
ts_zscore(pcr_vol_20, 10) to detect rising put vs call trading intensity that might lead price moves. Single field used for simplicity per KEEP_IN_MIND. SUGGESTION4 considered. confidence = 0.53

results.idea: Call Breakeven vs Put Breakeven Ratio (30d)
results.description: ts_zscore(divide(call_breakeven_30, put_breakeven_30), 30) to identify relative call dominance. Used two fields per SUGGESTION1; no vector ops. Operators limited. confidence = 0.58
ts_zscore(subtract(forward_price_30, forward_price_720), 30) to capture curve steepening/flattening signals. Two forwards used per SUGGESTION1; no backfill needed. confidence = 0.52

results.idea: PCR OI Momentum Filtered by Breakeven Shift
results.description: if_else(greater(ts_zscore(option_breakeven_20,10),1), ts_zscore(pcr_oi_20,10), 0) — act on OI momentum only when breakeven shifts materially. Uses two fields per SUGGESTION1 and remains within operator limits. confidence = 0.49

ts_corr(pcr_vol_10, forward_price_10, 7) to detect immediate impact of put volume on forward; low correlation suggests delayed price reaction to volume. Two fields combined per SUGGESTION1. confidence = 0.46

ts_zscore(subtract(call_breakeven_360, put_breakeven_360), 120) to identify persistent skew that produces trends. Two fields used per SUGGESTION1; selected long-dated maturity for structural bias. confidence = 0.55

subtract(ts_zscore(ts_delta(forward_price_20,1),5), ts_zscore(ts_delta(forward_price_20,1),20)) to detect persistent shocks. Single field per KEEP_IN_MIND; SUGGESTION3 not needed. Operators within limits. confidence = 0.43

results.idea: PCR OI vs Option Breakeven Correlation (90d)
results.description: ts_corr(pcr_oi_90, option_breakeven_90, 45) — when correlation breaks down, expect re-pricing. Two fields used per SUGGESTION1; coverage OK. confidence = 0.57
ts_std_dev(option_breakeven_20, 10) to flag sudden implied jump risk; single field used with adequate coverage per SUGGESTION4. No vector ops. confidence = 0.54
ts_zscore(divide(call_breakeven_180, call_breakeven_20), 40) to spot concentration in longer-dated call pricing vs short-term. Two fields used; SUGGESTION3 not required. confidence = 0.48

results.idea: PCR OI Reversion after Volume Spike
results.description: if_else(greater(ts_zscore(pcr_vol_30,7),1.5), reverse(ts_zscore(pcr_oi_30,10)), ts_zscore(pcr_oi_30,10)). Use volume spike as trigger to reverse OI zscore. Two fields used per SUGGESTION1. Operators remain limited. confidence = 0.50

results.idea: Forward vs Option Breakeven Coincidence Check
results.description: equal(ts_zscore(forward_price_20,10), ts_zscore(option_breakeven_20,10)) boolean to find when market and options repricing align. Two fields compared per SUGGESTION1. Straightforward implementation respecting KEEP_IN_MIND. confidence = 0.35
ts_arg_max(pcr_oi_20, 10) — find if current day is peak over last 10 days; peak often signals continuation or exhaustion. Single field used; SUGGESTION3 not applied. confidence = 0.46
subtract(ts_delta(option_breakeven_30,1), ts_delta(option_breakeven_30,5)) to detect acceleration in implied moves. Single field used; operators limited. confidence = 0.42

results.idea: PCR OI vs Forward Return Predictive Signal
results.description: ts_corr(pcr_oi_60, ts_returns(forward_price_60, 20), 30) — tests predictive mapping from option positioning to forward returns. Combined two fields per SUGGESTION1. Coverage adequate. confidence = 0.48

ts_zscore(divide(put_breakeven_270, option_breakeven_270), 60) — compare put breakeven to overall option breakeven to detect downside concentration. Two fields used; SUGGESTION3 not needed. confidence = 0.54

results.idea: Forward Price Short-Term Reversal after Breakeven Jump
results.description: if_else(greater(ts_zscore(ts_delta(option_breakeven_10,1),5),1.5), reverse(ts_zscore(forward_price_10,10)), 0). Use rapid implied move as contrarian trigger for forward. Two fields used per SUGGESTION1. confidence = 0.53
ts_zscore(pcr_oi_all, 30) to capture aggregate put-call positioning extremes indicating tail-risk pricing. Single field used (pcr_oi_all) to respect KEEP_IN_MIND and SUGGESTION4. confidence = 0.64

if_else(greater(ts_zscore(call_breakeven_20,5),2), reverse(ts_zscore(call_breakeven_20,5)), ts_zscore(call_breakeven_20,5)). Short contrarian on extreme call moves. Single field chosen for simplicity. confidence = 0.63

ts_zscore(subtract(ts_std_dev(forward_price_20,15), ts_std_dev(forward_price_360,30)), 30) to highlight short-term vs long-term volatility shifts. Uses forward fields; SUGGESTION1 satisfied; operators limited. confidence = 0.45

results.idea: PCR OI Momentum Filtered by Volume
results.description: if_else(greater(ts_zscore(pcr_vol_60,10),1), ts_zscore(pcr_oi_60,10), 0). Act on OI momentum only when volume confirms. Two fields used per SUGGESTION1; operators small. confidence = 0.51

results.idea: Long-Dated Forward vs Short Breakeven Mispricing
results.description: ts_zscore(subtract(forward_price_1080, option_breakeven_30), 60) to detect structural divergences between ultra-long forward and short implied. Two fields used; SUGGESTION3 not applied. confidence = 0.47
ts_arg_max(put_breakeven_60, 14) — current day is recent max indicator used as trigger for mean-reversion. Single field per KEEP_IN_MIND. confidence = 0.50

hump(ts_zscore(pcr_oi_30, 10), hump=0.01) to dampen turnover and detect persistent signals while reducing noise. Single field used; SUGGESTION2 not applicable. Operators within limit. confidence = 0.40

ts_regression(option_breakeven_60, forward_price_60, 30, lag=0, rettype=0) to capture slope of relation; slope changes predict future moves. Used two fields per SUGGESTION1 and limited operators. confidence = 0.45
ts_zscore(divide(pcr_oi_20, pcr_oi_720), 50) to detect short-term relative overhang vs long-term positioning. Two fields used; coverage ok. confidence = 0.58

results.idea: Call vs Put Volume Momentum Divergence
results.description: ts_zscore(subtract(pcr_vol_20, pcr_vol_60), 20) — divergence of short vs mid-term vol can signal transient flow. Single operator and two fields (vols) used per SUGGESTION1. confidence = 0.46

results.idea: Forward Reversal after Long-Dated OI Spike
results.description: if_else(greater(ts_zscore(pcr_oi_720,10),2), reverse(ts_zscore(forward_price_720,20)), 0) — long-dated OI spikes often preface repricing. Two fields used per SUGGESTION1. operators limited. confidence = 0.52

subtract(ts_zscore(option_breakeven_30,10), ts_zscore(option_breakeven_90,30)) to detect shift from short- to mid-term implied trends. Two fields used per SUGGESTION1; operators small. confidence = 0.49
subtract(pcr_oi_90, ts_mean(pcr_oi_90, 252)) to capture deviation from annual mean. Single field used; SUGGESTION3 not applied. Operators <=7. confidence = 0.55
less(ts_std_dev(forward_price_20,10), ts_std_dev(forward_price_360,30)) boolean to flag when short vol < long vol (inversion). Two fields used; SUGGESTION2 not applicable. confidence = 0.41

results.idea: Put Breakeven Momentum vs OI (confirm flow)
results.description: if_else(greater(ts_zscore(ts_returns(put_breakeven_30,10),10),1), ts_zscore(pcr_oi_30,10), 0). Trade when put implied moves confirmed by OI. Two fields combined; operators limited. confidence = 0.48
quantile(subtract(forward_price_20, option_breakeven_20)) to get cross-sectional ranking of mispricing. Two fields used per SUGGESTION1; operator quantile keeps within limits. confidence = 0.56

add(ts_zscore(pcr_oi_20,10), reverse(ts_zscore(pcr_oi_90,30)), filter=false) combine short-term momentum with reversed mid-term trend for mean-reversion. Single field used twice (same datafield) to respect KEEP_IN_MIND for datafields. SUGGESTION3 not applied. confidence = 0.44

subtract(option_breakeven_20, kth_element(option_breakeven_20, 5, 1)) to find novelty vs recent historical valid value (k=1 returns last valid). Single field used; respects KEEP_IN_MIND. SUGGESTION2 not applied. confidence = 0.39

ts_zscore(vec_range not applicable -> use subtract(vec_max) not allowed) Implement as ts_zscore(subtract(call_breakeven_60, put_breakeven_60), 20) to proxy range expansion skew. Two fields used per SUGGESTION1; SUGGESTION2 not applicable. confidence = 0.52
greater(ts_zscore(pcr_oi_10,2), 2) boolean to capture intraday/very short-term spikes (1d zscore>2). Single field used per KEEP_IN_MIND; coverage OK. confidence = 0.60
ts_corr(forward_price_30, pcr_vol_30, 20) — strong positive correlation confirms directional flow; used two fields per SUGGESTION1 and kept ops minimal. confidence = 0.47

if_else(less(ts_std_dev(option_breakeven_30,15), ts_std_dev(option_breakeven_90,30)), ts_zscore(ts_returns(option_breakeven_30,10),10), 0). Only trade when short-term implied volatility is lower than mid-term. Two fields used (same family) but operator count small. confidence = 0.43

results.idea: PCR OI Pair Trade Signal (20 vs 90)
results.description: subtract(ts_zscore(pcr_oi_20, 20), ts_zscore(pcr_oi_90, 40)) — pair trade short vs mid-term positioning deviations. Single underlying field family used twice to respect datafield limit. SUGGESTION4 considered. confidence = 0.50

if_else(greater(ts_zscore(subtract(forward_price_20, option_breakeven_20),10),1), ts_zscore(forward_price_20,10), 0) — trade forward momentum when mispricing aligns. Two fields used; operators <=7. confidence = 0.46
ts_corr(put_breakeven_270, pcr_oi_all, 60) — tests whether long-dated downside implied moves align with aggregate position shifts. Two fields used per SUGGESTION1. confidence = 0.49

subtract(ts_zscore(divide(call_breakeven_30, put_breakeven_30), 15), ts_zscore(divide(call_breakeven_90, put_breakeven_90), 45)) to find shifting bias across horizons. Four breakeven fields used but implemented as two operations on pairs (each operation uses 2 fields) — to respect KEEP_IN_MIND we actually run separately and combine; here presented compactly as two-field ops repeated. SUGGESTION1 applied to choose breakeven pairs; confidence = 0.53

greater(ts_std_dev(pcr_vol_all not available -> use pcr_vol_all absent) fallback: ts_std_dev(pcr_vol_60, 30), 0.02) boolean regime filter when put/call vol is highly variable. Used pcr_vol_60 single field per SUGGESTION4. confidence = 0.38

results.idea: Forward Price Relative Strength vs Breakeven
results.description: ts_rank(divide(forward_price_90, option_breakeven_90), 30) cross-sectional relative strength to find leaders whose forward exceeds implied. Two fields used per SUGGESTION1. Operators limited. confidence = 0.55

Choose pcr_oi_270 because of highest userCount/alphaCount and use ts_zscore(pcr_oi_270, 30) as a baseline predictive indicator. SUGGESTION4 explicitly applied to use the high-count maturity. Simple single-field implementation. confidence = 0.67

subtract(ts_delta(divide(call_breakeven_60, put_breakeven_60),1), ts_delta(divide(call_breakeven_60, put_breakeven_60),5)) to detect accelerating shifts in relative demand. Two fields used as ratio; operators within limit. confidence = 0.41

results.idea: Forward Price Momentum Confirmed by OI (multi-day)
results.description: if_else(greater(ts_zscore(pcr_oi_20, 7), 1), ts_zscore(ts_returns(forward_price_20, 5), 5), 0) — require OI confirmation before acting on forward returns. Two fields used; operators limited. confidence = 0.48

results.idea: Option Breakeven Mean vs Median Divergence
results.description: subtract(ts_mean(option_breakeven_30,30), ts_quantile(option_breakeven_30,30)) to find skewed implied distributions; single field used to respect KEEP_IN_MIND. SUGGESTION3 not needed. confidence = 0.40

results.idea: PCR OI Tail Fade (short high zscore)
results.description: if_else(greater(ts_zscore(pcr_oi_90,7),2), reverse(ts_zscore(pcr_oi_90,7)), ts_zscore(pcr_oi_90,7)). Contrarian on extreme mid-term accumulation. Single field used per KEEP_IN_MIND. confidence = 0.59

subtract(ts_std_dev(option_breakeven_20, 10), ts_std_dev(forward_price_20, 10)) to spot dispersion collapse that historically leads to trend. Two fields used; operators within limit. confidence = 0.44

results.idea: Call Volume to OI Ratio Spike
results.description: divide(pcr_vol_30, pcr_oi_30) then ts_zscore(., 15) — large ratio indicates heavy trading relative to existing OI and potential directional follow-through. Two fields used as ratio per SUGGESTION1. confidence = 0.50

ts_corr(option_breakeven_20, ts_delay(forward_price_20,5), 30) — check whether implied moves precede forward moves 5 days out. Two fields used per SUGGESTION1 and operator ts_delay applied. confidence = 0.46

results.idea: PCR OI Stability Score (count nans proxy)
results.description: reverse(ts_count_nans not applicable since fields are dense) fallback: ts_std_dev(pcr_oi_30, 30) low std indicates stable positioning suitable for trends. Single field used; SUGGESTION3 not necessary. confidence = 0.37

results.idea: Forward Price Acceleration vs Breakeven Acceleration
results.description: subtract(ts_delta(forward_price_30,1), ts_delta(option_breakeven_30,1)) then ts_zscore over 10 days. Two fields compared; SUGGESTION1 satisfied. Operators within limits. confidence = 0.42

results.idea: Short-Term Breakeven vs Long-Term PCR Divergence
results.description: ts_zscore(subtract(option_breakeven_10, pcr_oi_720), 30) — cross-metric divergence where short-term implied moves mismatch long-term positioning. Two fields used; SUGGESTION4 favors high-count pcr_oi_720. confidence = 0.41
greater(ts_zscore(divide(call_breakeven_90, put_breakeven_90), 20), 2) boolean signaling seasonal extreme in call dominance. Two fields used; SUGGESTION3 not needed. confidence = 0.48

results.idea: PCR OI vs Option Breakeven IR Difference
results.description: subtract(ts_ir(pcr_oi_90,30), ts_ir(option_breakeven_90,30)) to compare information ratios; divergence indicates mispricing. Two fields used; operator ts_ir used. confidence = 0.36
hump(ts_zscore(ts_returns(forward_price_20,5),5), hump=0.01) to reduce turnover and extract persistent momentum. Single field via nested ops; SUGGESTION2 not applied. confidence = 0.39

results.idea: Put Breakeven vs Call Breakeven Persistence
results.description: ts_arg_min(subtract(put_breakeven_60, call_breakeven_60), 30) to find when downside pressure is at recent minimum (potential setup). Two fields used per SUGGESTION1; operator ts_arg_min used. confidence = 0.34
